result.execSummary:
Brittani Jo Stoney was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Brittani Jo Stoney was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brittani Jo Stoney

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brittani Jo Stoney in court, in custody at Grant County Jail.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Peter Bartelt appeared in court. Attorney Bartelt heard and defendant is prepared to waive extradition. Defendant signs waiver of extradition. Court approves waiver of extradition. State heard on defendant's bond on other cases.

Brittani Stoney appeared in person, in custody from Grant County Jail. Attorney Peter Bartelt appeared by phone. Attorney Anthony Pozorski appeared in court. Attorney Pozorski swear to complaint. Court reviews extradition rights and extradition complaint. Defendant is unsure if she wants to waive. Court orders $1000 cash bond. Extradition hearing set.
Extradition hearing on May 6, 2022 at 11:30 am.
